page.title: 11Farming around Coates
page.content: THIS GRID AREA IS A NOTED FARMING AREA. THE DARK PEAT SOIL IS AN IDEAL GROWING MEDIUM, AND THE FLATNESS OF THE AREA LEND THEM SELVES TO ARABLE FARMING.THE REMOVAL OF TREES AND HEDGES AND THE INCREASED SIZE OF FARMS AND THEIR FIELDS MAKE THE USE OF LARGE MACHINES EASIER. FARMING IS EXTREMELY INTENSIVE, PARTICULARLY AS E.E.C. SUBSIDIES ENCOURAGE THE SORT OF CROP GROWING SUITED TO THIS AREA. THERE IS A HIGH USE OF CHEMICAL FERTILISERS, INSECTICIDES, AND WEED KILLERS. ROOT VEGETABLES (CARROTS, POTATOES), CEREALS (WHEAT, BARLEY), AND SUGAR BEET ARE THE MOST COMMON, TOGETHER WITH OIL - SEED RAPE. THE WHITTLESEY AREA IS RENOWNED FOR GROWING CELERY - WHITTLESEY SEEDLINGS ARE SENT AROUND THE WORLD TO GROW ON.
